did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Papers of the National War Labor Board on Microfilm, 1918-1919
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Minutes, case files, and records of the National War Labor Board.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The National War Labor Board (NWLB) was appointed by President Woodrow Wilson in April, 1918. Guided by the principles of labor relations suggested by the President's Mediation Commission in September, 1917, the Board's purpose was to settle labor-management disputes and stabilize wages during World War I. The NWLB consisted of five industry representatives (chosen by the National Industrial Conference Board), five labor representatives (chosen by the A.F.of L.), and two co-chairs appointed by President Wilson.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: The records consist of digests of cases, examiners' reports, findings and awards, selected case files and proceedings transcripts, and executive session minutes documenting the work of the National War Labor Board. Also included are minutes of NWLB public meetings, selected administrative files and general subject files.
